definitions: scheduled stop between flights or connecting transportation requiring temporary waiting
close-range basketball shot made by rolling ball off backboard
examples: We had a six-hour layover in Chicago airport
The layover gave us time to explore the city briefly
She scored easily with a perfect layover shot
His layover technique needs practice against taller defenders

definitions: close-range basketball shot made near basket using backboard
period when vessel or vehicle is temporarily out of service
examples: He made an easy layup after stealing the ball
Practice your layups from both sides of the basket
The ship went into layup for winter maintenance
During layup, the aircraft undergoes complete inspection procedures

definitions: open area of grassy land used for grazing or cultivation
examples: Cattle grazed peacefully in the sunny lea
The shepherd led his flock across the flowering lea

definitions: process of removing or extracting substances by percolating liquid through material
examples: Heavy rain can leach nutrients from the soil
The mining company uses chemicals to leach gold from ore

definitions: continuous removal of soluble substances from soil or other material by water
examples: Leaching of minerals affects soil fertility significantly
Prevent nutrient leaching by using slow-release fertilizers

definitions: soft heavy toxic metallic element with atomic number 82
position of being ahead or in charge of others
wire or cable conducting electrical current to device
foremost place in competition or race
examples: Lead pipes were replaced due to health concerns
The paint contains dangerous levels of lead
She took the lead in organizing the charity event
Follow my lead and everything will work out fine
Check the electrical leads before connecting the battery
The guitar lead needs to be longer for stage performances
Their team maintained a comfortable lead throughout the game
He's in the lead with just two laps remaining

definitions: person who guides or directs a group, organization, or country
person or thing that is ahead in a race or competition
examples: The team leader assigned tasks to each member
She emerged as a natural leader during the crisis
The race leader maintained a steady pace
Industry leaders set trends that others follow

definitions: ability to guide, inspire, and influence others toward achieving goals
collective body of leaders in an organization or movement
examples: Her leadership skills improved through training and experience
Effective leadership requires empathy and clear communication
The company's leadership decided to restructure the departments
Union leadership met with management to discuss wages

definitions: act of showing the way or being in charge
vertical spacing between lines of text in printing
examples: His leading of the expedition proved successful
The leading of the orchestra requires years of training
Adjust the leading to improve text readability
The designer increased the leading for better visual balance

definitions: flat green structure growing from plant stem that performs photosynthesis
single sheet of paper or thin material in a book
hinged or removable section that extends a table
examples: The maple leaf turned brilliant red in autumn
Each leaf captures sunlight for the tree's growth
Turn to the next leaf to continue reading
A gold leaf covered the ancient manuscript
Add the extra leaf when we have dinner guests
The dining table has two leaves stored underneath

definitions: small printed paper containing information or advertising distributed freely
individual segment of a compound leaf in plants
examples: They handed out leaflets about the upcoming election
The store's promotional leaflet listed all the sales
Each leaflet of the clover has a distinct shape
The fern's leaflets spread out from the central stem

definitions: organized group of sports teams that compete against each other regularly
association of people or groups united for mutual benefit
historical unit of distance approximately three miles
examples: Our team finished third in the league this season
The premier league attracts millions of viewers worldwide
The nations formed a league for mutual defense
She's not in the same league as professional players
The ship traveled many leagues across the ocean
Seven leagues from the castle lay the enchanted forest

definitions: unintended escape of liquid or gas through hole or crack
unauthorized disclosure of confidential information to public
examples: The plumber fixed the leak under the kitchen sink
A small leak in the roof caused water damage
The leak of classified documents sparked an investigation
Someone in the department was responsible for the leak

definitions: process or instance of liquid or gas escaping from container
gradual loss of resources or information from a system
examples: Water leakage damaged the ceiling below the bathroom
Check for oil leakage around the engine seals
Revenue leakage costs the company millions annually
Data leakage poses serious security risks

definitions: meat containing little fat or with fat trimmed away
natural tendency or preference toward particular position or opinion
examples: Choose lean cuts of beef for healthier meals
The butcher recommended lean ground turkey
His political lean is toward conservative policies
The committee's lean favors environmental protection

definitions: person actively trying to reduce body weight or fat
temporary support structure that leans against something else
examples: As a dedicated leaner, she tracks her daily calories
The gym attracts many leaners seeking transformation
Place the leaner against the wall for stability
The construction crew used leaners to support the framework

definitions: tendency to favor particular opinion, belief, or course of action
state of being positioned at an angle from vertical
examples: Her political leanings became clear during the debate
His artistic leanings influenced his career choice
The leaning of the tower increases slightly each year
Check the leaning of the fence posts after the storm

definitions: sudden spring or jump through air covering distance
dramatic advance or increase in progress or development
examples: The athlete's leap cleared the high jump bar
With a mighty leap, the cat reached the roof
Technology took a giant leap forward this decade
Her leap in understanding came after months of study

definitions: game where players vault over each other's bent backs
method of advancing by bypassing intermediate stages or competitors
examples: Children played leapfrog in the schoolyard during recess
Leapfrog requires trust between the jumping and crouching players
The company used leapfrog tactics to overtake competitors
Developing nations can leapfrog older technologies entirely

definitions: continuous or repeated action of jumping through air energetically
examples: The leaping of dolphins delighted the cruise passengers
His leaping across the stepping stones required careful balance

definitions: person who is acquiring knowledge or developing a skill
examples: Adult learners often bring valuable experience to classes
She's a quick learner who masters new concepts easily

definitions: process of acquiring knowledge, skills, or understanding through study or experience
body of knowledge that has been acquired through education
examples: Online learning has transformed modern education methods
Her learning style favors visual presentations
His vast learning impressed the academic committee
Centuries of learning are preserved in these ancient texts

definitions: legal agreement allowing use of property for specified time and payment
period of time covered by a rental agreement
examples: They signed a lease for the downtown apartment
The lease requires monthly rent payments in advance
Her lease expires at the end of next month
We negotiated a five-year lease for the office space

definitions: legal right to occupy property for agreed period under lease terms
examples: The leasehold on their flat has ninety years remaining
Converting from leasehold to freehold requires significant investment

definitions: cord or strap used to control and restrain an animal
examples: Keep your dog on a leash in public areas
The retractable leash extends up to fifteen feet

definitions: durable material made from treated animal skin used for clothing and goods
examples: The leather jacket lasted for over twenty years
Italian leather is prized for its quality and softness

definitions: largest species of sea turtle with leathery shell instead of hard carapace
examples: The leatherback can dive deeper than any other turtle
Leatherback populations face threats from plastic pollution

definitions: authorized absence from work or duty for specified period
formal permission to do something or be absent
examples: She took maternity leave for three months
Annual leave must be scheduled with your supervisor
The soldier requested leave to visit his family
Grant me leave to speak freely on this matter

definitions: act or process of going away from a place or situation
examples: Her leaving created a vacancy in the department
The leaving of students marks the end of term

definitions: tall stand with sloped top used to hold books or notes for speaker
examples: The professor adjusted the lectern before beginning her presentation
A microphone was attached to the wooden lectern

definitions: formal presentation on a specific topic delivered to an audience
lengthy reproof or scolding about behavior or actions
examples: The guest lecture on climate change drew hundreds of students
She prepared detailed slides for her lecture
His parents gave him a lecture about responsibility
I don't need another lecture about my spending habits

definitions: person who gives lectures, especially as university faculty member
examples: The lecturer explained quantum physics with clear examples
She works as a senior lecturer in the history department

definitions: post or appointment as a lecturer at a university or college
examples: She accepted a lectureship at Oxford University
The lectureship includes both teaching and research responsibilities

definitions: activity of giving lectures or formal educational presentations
examples: His lecturing style engages students through interactive discussions
After years of lecturing, she wrote several textbooks

definitions: narrow horizontal surface projecting from a wall or cliff
underwater ridge or reef near the water's surface
examples: Birds nested on the narrow ledge of the building
He carefully placed the vase on the window ledge
Divers explored the underwater ledge teeming with fish
The ledge drops off sharply into deep water

definitions: book or digital record system for keeping financial accounts and transactions
examples: The accountant updated the ledger with daily transactions
Historical ledgers reveal the company's financial evolution

definitions: side or area sheltered from wind or weather
examples: The sailors anchored in the lee of the island
We picnicked in the lee of the large rocks

definitions: aquatic or terrestrial worm that attaches to and feeds on blood
person who persistently takes advantage of others' generosity
examples: Doctors once used leeches for bloodletting treatments
The hikers found leeches attached to their legs
He's a financial leech who borrows but never repays
Don't be a leech on your parents' resources

definitions: edible plant related to onion with long white bulb and flat green leaves
examples: Welsh soup traditionally features leeks as main ingredient
She saut√©ed leeks with butter for the quiche

definitions: unpleasant facial expression suggesting inappropriate sexual interest or malicious satisfaction
examples: His leer made everyone at the party uncomfortable
She ignored the leer from the stranger

definitions: side or direction toward which the wind is blowing
examples: The leeward islands receive less rainfall than windward ones
Sail to the leeward side for calmer waters

definitions: amount of freedom to move or act within set limits
examples: The contract gives us some leeway on delivery dates
Teachers need leeway to adapt lessons for different students

definitions: side opposite to right when facing forward
political parties or groups favoring liberal or socialist views
what remains after other parts are taken or used
examples: Turn left at the next traffic light
She writes with her left hand
The left advocates for increased social programs
He aligned himself with the political left
Save the left for tomorrow's lunch
Only crumbs were left after the party

definitions: person who supports liberal, socialist, or radical political views
examples: The leftist proposed sweeping social reforms
Campus leftists organized protests against tuition increases

definitions: food remaining after a meal that can be stored and eaten later
examples: We'll have leftovers for lunch tomorrow
She created a new dish using yesterday's leftovers

definitions: informal term for person who primarily uses their left hand
examples: As a lefty, she needs special scissors
The baseball team recruited a talented lefty pitcher

definitions: limb used for standing and walking in humans and animals
supporting part of furniture or structure resembling a limb
distinct stage or portion of a journey or race
examples: She broke her leg skiing last winter
The horse injured its front leg during the race
The table leg needs to be repaired
One leg of the tripod is adjustable
The final leg of their journey took them through mountains
She ran the last leg of the relay race

definitions: money or property left to someone in a will
long-lasting impact of a person's life, actions, or achievements
examples: Her grandmother left her a substantial legacy
The legacy included both property and investments
His legacy as a civil rights leader continues today
The company's legacy of innovation spans decades

definitions: process of making something that was previously illegal permitted by law
examples: The legalisation of marijuana remains controversial
Activists campaign for the legalisation of same-sex marriage

definitions: quality or state of being in accordance with the law
examples: Lawyers questioned the legality of the government's actions
The legality of the contract depends on proper signatures
